name: 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane (2s,3s)
Reason: 1,2:3,4-diepoxybutane has a melting point that we can compare to butene, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be butene, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion increases the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
